did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Subject files, correspondence, notes, drafts of essays, printed material.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The collection consists of the papers of Harry Langhorne, a Philadelphia area gay activist and executive officer of the Gay Activists Alliance of Philadelphia. Includes subject files relating to all aspects of the gay movement and of other liberal and radical social causes.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Harry Langhorne was an executive administrator of the Gay Activists Alliance of Philadelphia (GAA) from 1972 to 1977.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p:
The collection consists of the subject files kept by Langhorne while at the Gay Activists Alliance (GAA), as well as his correspondence, notes, drafts of essays, and other accumulated printed material. The committees referred to in the files are those of GAA. Topics include gay legal rights and legislation, sodomy laws, gay
politics including especially gay Marxism, bi- and transsexuality, gay media concerns, sex education, homophobia, special gay interest groups such as handicapped gays, and gay-church issues. The collection documents relations between CAA and the gay liberation movement and Philadelphia, the State of Pennsylvania, and national political
governments, especially pertaining to their statues and practices relating to the gay movement. GAA communications with other regional and national gay organizations and many of their publications are included.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Harry Langhorne papers, #7304. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: The arrangement of the files is alphabetical according to the original folder headings, with a small additional group of miscellaneous and unordered subject files following.

did.unittitle: Committee for a Gay Rights Bill
GAA - Papers: Minutes, Notes, Membership Lists
GAA - Press Releases and Media Coverage

did.abstract: Includes "Gay Liberator," other newsletters, correspondence, and position papers
Includes "Chicago Gay Pride CGA Newsletter," "Challenge," "AC/DC Atlantic City," and others

did.unittitle: Gay Students at the University of Pennsylvania
Gay Students at the University of Pittsburgh

did.abstract: Includes "Just Us - A Directory of the Washington Gay Community"

did.unittitle: Gay and Women's Alliance for Responsible Media - "GWARM Monitor"
Gay Youth - "GY Gay Youth's Gay Journal"

did.abstract: Typewritten and handwritten minutes and notes
Statement by Harry Langhorne before the regional Democratic Platform Committee Hearing, 3 June 1972; also National Gay Community for McGovern
"Zap!" From the State College Gay Community

did.unittitle: La Salle College Students for Individual Rights

did.abstract: "Come Out Fighting," the Newspaper of the LRU
Society for Individual Rights Pocket Lawyer; "If You Are Arrested"

did.unittitle: Fellowship of Metropolitan Community Churches - Washington
NAACP (National Association for the Advancement of Colored People)

did.abstract: Gay Rights Advisory Committee, Governors's Council for Sexual Minorities, and other legal matters
Langhorne draft manuscripts of articles; discussion of Walt Whitman

did.unittitle: Pittsburgh State Conference (Pennsylvania State Gay Convention)
San Francisco Association for Mental Health
SIECUS (Sex Information and Education Council of the United States)
SIR (Society for Individual Rights - San Francisco)
State (Gay Task Force, Council for Sexual Minorities)
Stonewall - Seattle; Gay Community Services, Minnesota
Transvestites, including "Journal of Male Feminism" v. 77, no. 2 and National Alliance for Heterosexual Male Feminism items.
"Vanguard Vanities", Vanguard Motor Club of Philadelphia, founded 1969
WUHY Radio ("Rest of the News" Brochure)

did.abstract: Notes, lists, drafts of letters and essays

did.unittitle: GAA - Materials Prepared for Presentation to the People's Fund
"Religious Roots of the Taboo on Homosexuality"
"Report of the Pennsylvania Council for Sexual Minorities"
